body_content.explanation: a type of computer game, especially one played on a mobile phone, in which users can pay to get a new character, ability, object, etc. at random (= by chance, without intentionally choosing which):
examples: Are gachas OK for 10 year old kids?
Games that rely on randomized in-game transactions are known as Gacha games.

body_content.explanation: a feature of a computer game in which users can pay to get a new character, ability, object, etc. at random (= by chance):
examples: The game makes money by encouraging players to pay for a chance to win new characters, a feature known as "gacha".
A gacha game is a game that operates the gacha mechanism.

body_content.explanation: a small plastic toy that you buy without you knowing which one you are going to get, for example from a vending machine (= a machine from which you can buy small things by putting money into it or using a card) or from a special shop:
examples: He loves gacha and he spends most of his pocket money on them.
You put a coin in the machine and crank the handle, but you can't predict which gasha you will get!
